text:
In the following sentence, there is an underlined word and one gap. From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence. 
Binetou's inquisitiveness is in sharp contrast with her sister's
explanation:
The word Inquisitiveness means; given to inquiry, research, or asking questions; eager for knowledge; intellectually curious. The most nearly opposite in meaning to Inquisitiveness from the options is ''Indifference.
Indifference means; lack of interest or concern.

text:

explanation:
The word insignificant means;  unimportant, trifling, or petty.
While
Remarkable means; worthy of notice or attention.

while

text:
In the following sentence, there is an underlined word and one gap. From the list of words lettered A to D, choose the one that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentence. 
Halima likes to dwell on trivial, rather than _______ matters.
explanation:
The word trivial means;  of little value or importance, of very little importance or value; insignificant.
synonyms:unimportant, insignificant, inconsequential, minor, of no/little account, of no/little consequence, of no/little importance
The word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word is weighty. This means something that is of great seriousness and importance.

text:

explanation:

From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence. 
The Politician is a fluent speaker.

From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence. 
Everyone has the urge to succeed in life.
explanation: "urge" refers to a strong desire or impulse, particularly the compelling drive or motivation to succeed in life. The word "desire" closely aligns with the meaning of "urge" in this context. Both convey a strong wish or longing for something and in this case, it's the desire for success. So, in the given sentence, the word "urge" is used to express the strong inner drive or desire that everyone has to succeed in life. Therefore, option B. "desire" is the most suitable choice.

From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word or group of words that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word as it is used in the sentence. 
We really have to be careful because the situation is rather tricky.
explanation:
When we describe a situation as "tricky," we mean that it is not straightforward or easy to deal with. It often involves complexities or challenges that require careful handling and consideration. In the given sentence, "We really have to be careful because the situation is rather tricky," the speaker is expressing caution because they recognize that the situation is not simple or easy to navigate.
Therefore, option D, "difficult," is the most suitable choice because it captures the sense of complexity and challenges associated with a tricky situation.

text:

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences. 
_______ arrived before the manager.
explanation: When using pronouns in compound subjects like this one, we use the subjective case (I, he, she, we, they) rather than the objective case (me, him, her, us, them). So, "Neither he nor I" is correct instead of "Neither me nor him."

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences. 
The evening was rounded _____ with a dance.

I _______ have done the dishes but i haven't had the time.

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences. 
Life in the city is ________ challenging for the lazy.

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences. 
It is always ________ that gets the blame
explanation:
The verb 'to be' (i.e. am, is, are, were, been and being) does not. take an object. This means that the pronoun that comes after it must be a subject. E.g.
1. It isIwho gave you that pen.
2. It wastheynotwe, who jumped the fence.
The sentence "It is always ________ that gets the blame" therefore, takes the subject "I" as in:
"It is alwaysIthat gets the blame."

explanation: The phrase"one ... or the other"is the correct idiomatic expression in English, meaning that there is always some excuse being given, even if it varies.

I know it's a secret, so I _____  tell anyone.
explanation: "shan't" is the contraction for "shall not" and this is the modal verb used here because part of secret-keeping is the obligation not to tell anyone otherwise it is not longer a secret. The other modal verbs - "couldn't", "needn't" and "mightn't" - do not reflect the obligation. They do not show that it is compulsory to not tell anyone.

text:

My parents taught me a lot of lessons, most of ______ are difficult to forget.

I have made remarkable progress ______ learning French.

From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences. 
The beans have not been properly ________
explanation:
In the sentence, the verb "properly" is used to describe how the action of grinding the beans was performed. The correct form of the verb "grind" to use with "properly" is "ground."
Here's why "ground" is the correct choice:
- "Grind" is the base form of the verb, used in the present tense (e.g., "I grind the coffee beans every morning").- "Ground" is the past participle form of the verb, used to form the past tense and past perfect tense (e.g., "I ground the coffee beans yesterday" or "I have ground the coffee beans before").
In the sentence "The beans have not been properly ground," "ground" is the past participle form of "grind" and is used because the action of grinding the beans happened in the past and is completed.

In the following sentence, the word that receives the emphatic stress is written in capital letter. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer. 
AYO asked Mary to come today.

options.A: Did Chike ask Mary to come?
options.B: Did Ayo order Mary to come today?
options.C: Did Ayo ask Dad to come today?
options.D: Did Ayo ask Mary to come today?

text:
In the following sentence, the word that receives the emphatic stress is written in capital letter. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer. 
Wood is cheap in the South THIS year.

options.A: Is cassava cheap in the south?
options.B: Is wood expensive in the south this year?
options.C: Is wood cheap in the north this year?
options.D: Is wood cheap in the south every year?

text:
In the following sentence, the word that receives the emphatic stress is written in capital letter. From the questions lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer. 
NEW students should pay tuition fees.

options.A: Should new students pay tuition fees?
options.B: Should old students pay tuition fees?
options.C: Should new students pay hostel fees?
options.D: Can new students pay tuition fees?

text:

options.A: Did mum request the driver to open the door?
options.B: Did dad order the driver to open the door?
options.C: Did dad request the gardener to open the door?
options.D: Did dad request the driver to shut the door?
